modal_info.title: Platform 2D game
modal_info.subtitle: Unity
modal_info.description: In UFO Fall, you become an alien survivor of the mysterious Roswell crash, on a mission to recover your ship and crew, but with fragmented memories. Only your connection to plants remains clear. As you journey through eerie desert landscapes and the guarded depths of Area 51, you'll solve puzzles and face challenges, using your alien abilities to interact with the environment. Little by little, the truth behind your crash, your mission, and the strange world around you unfolds, leading to a deeper revelation. Your past and future hang in the balance—what will you discover?

modal_info.title: Neil 3D model
modal_info.subtitle: Maya
modal_info.description: The 3D model character for 'Neil' was meticulously crafted using Maya, a leading 3D modeling software. This alien character features a sleek, otherworldly design that reflects its extraterrestrial origins. The model showcases a unique blend of organic and futuristic elements, with a slender build and elongated limbs, giving it an agile and graceful appearance.

parts.name: Basic model
parts.description: The entire 3D model, including the head, body is designed with a low-poly structure, optimized for performance without compromising on visual quality. The mesh is simplified with a focus on maintaining a minimal polygon count while preserving the essential forms and features.

parts.name: Head model
parts.description: The model features well-defined edge loops, particularly around the eyes and mouth, known as mask loops, which enhance the natural flow and realistic expression of the face. These loops provide a clean and efficient mesh structure, crucial for achieving lifelike animations and detailed facial expressions.

parts.name: Body model
parts.description: The 3D body model is crafted with meticulous attention to topology, prioritizing clean, quads-only geometry to prevent issues with deformation during animation. The model incorporates strategically placed edge loops around key joints and anatomical features, such as the shoulders, elbows, and knees, which facilitate realistic bending and movement.

parts.name: Clothes and prop model
parts.description: The mesh is composed predominantly of quads, avoiding ngons and poles, which ensures smooth deformation during animation and prevents issues such as texture stretching. Edge loops are strategically placed to define the natural folds and creases in the fabric, especially around areas of movement like the joints and waist.
